website_summaries.verdict: A great option to consider for the DIY-er wanting to maintain their own vehicle.
pros: Extremely easy to install quickly in one sitting
Provides a high filtering capacity that will last for many miles before needing to be replaced
cons: More limited vehicle compatibility compared to other filters

customer_reviews.title: Black Market Parts!
customer_reviews.text: These filters are NOT "Motorcraft" filters! They are bootleg Chinese made. I found out the hard way. Do your homework. Look up "Counterfeit Motocraft Parts" and you'll get a tutorial on how to spot a fake. I bought one of these because the price was so good. TOO good actually. China is making bogus spark plugs, oil filters, coils and coil packs, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Lonesomerider

customer_reviews.title: A made in USA OEM part but without the box
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can get an OEM filter from Amazon for a good price, and that this filter unlike some other Motorcraft filters is still made in the USA, but I don't like the fact that it is shown in the OEM box but comes without one). (And I did purchase this from Amazon.com and not one of their marketplace sellers). In the future I will choose to purchase this filter from a certain big-box retailer that I have since found has it for the same price - in the OEM box.
customer_reviews.author: MTM

customer_reviews.title: Cannot go wrong with stock!
customer_reviews.text: A pretty basic item. It comes in a cardboard box as depicted, it is not plastic wrapped but they never are. Looks good! Cheap, and made for conventional, blend or full synthetic oil. It even had directions for an oil change on the little tab inside. A nice little thing for a rookie car mechanic. It's a genuine and recommended Ford product. It may not be made in USA every time but it's for an American brand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ly

customer_reviews.title: It's factory replacement stuff, what's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I always buy factory replacement parts when I can. I learned a long time ago from my mechanic/friend that even in applications where you think it won't make a difference, it will. For Example, factory brake pads make the brake pedal feel more responsive, and behave like when the vehicle was new. Also learned that something as a small as a PCV valve should be a factory one because the pressure in the valve is different that an aftermarket one and makes the vehicle run properly. For the price, it just makes good sense. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Invoxicated

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: I thought motorcraft was for FORD use only, But I have a Toyota Sienna and this filter did the job! This filter in the price range that its in is the best filter for under 5 bucks! Im not cheap but for what you get it should cost $10, metal end caps, silicone ADV, and a lot of filter media for under 5 dollar theres not much you can get that gives you all that. Im happy with this filter and will use it in my Toyota and Lincoln navgiator.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: I was a bit disappointed by this
customer_reviews.text: The Motorcraft FL-910 oil filters were loose in the shipping box. The individual filters were not in a box, wrapped or anything. Filters need to stay free a debris inside to do their job. I cannot guarantee they are clean inside. I was a bit disappointed by this, especially when it showed with the factory box in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: High quality filters!
customer_reviews.text: Motorcraft filters are some of the best designed and built oil filters out there, and they're dirt cheap. I've taken apart most major brands of filters to examine the interiors and these are quite excellent. If you can use these, even on non-Ford vehicles, you're better off than most non-OEM filter designs you can find at the local parts store. They're even better than select OEM brands as well. Part of the allure is that they bypass high-pressure flow from the top of the filter, rather than the bottom where the particulates lay. Very few other brands do this.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Osburn

customer_reviews.title: They keep getting cheaper
customer_reviews.text: There are two vehicles in my fleet that use this filter. I keep a few in stock but the price has been going down over time. I've had no issues with Motorcraft filters and they seem to be perfectly adequate for my vehicles. They are OEM after all.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Motorcraft filters
customer_reviews.text: This is the OEM replacement filter for my car (2016 Ecoboost Mustang). It fits perfectly and I have no complaints. The construction seems solid and it's a good value given how cheap it is. It has a silicone anti-drainback valve and when replaced, shows no signs of deterioration or diffulty on therma of removal. It's likely not the absolute best filter out there, but hard to beat for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Typically decent filter at a good price. However
customer_reviews.text: Typically decent filter at a good price. However, the filters shipped from Amazon came unboxed. Usually filters are boxed to prevent damage and keep debris from getting inside them.
customer_reviews.author: Ray R.

customer_reviews.title: excellent filter
customer_reviews.text: good filtration and a great gasket, no leaks with hand tightening. I prefer the flat gaskets over the round gaskets. heavy duty metal can. very good anti drain back retention compared to purolator and fram. my oil looks a little dirtier at 1500 miles than it has in the past with toyota/denso filters. i think the delco filter MIGHT clean better but I prefer the Motorcraft gasket.
customer_reviews.author: T G

customer_reviews.title: Ford filters are the best.
customer_reviews.text: Dont get fooled by other filter makers claims. I've owned many fords and researched the best filters. Ford is making cars that push 400-500hp and these filters are the best you can find. You can look up cut away comparisons and Ford comes out as one of the best every time
customer_reviews.author: B.Lap

customer_reviews.title: Genuine FORD part that meets factory standards at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: There are many inexpensive filters out there. As a retired master mechanic, I've seen many. In this case, it's very affordable, but it also meets all FORD factory standards. For the same price, there is no need to purchase any other filter. This is what each Ford engine was engineered to use.
customer_reviews.author: Fleetside Garage

customer_reviews.title: I obviously need good quality but also didn't want to spend an arm ...
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for all the stuff to change the oil on both mine and my husband's vehicles, I obviously need good quality but also didn't want to spend an arm and a leg. This is a very affordable option, and seems to be great quality.
customer_reviews.author: McDaniel13

customer_reviews.title: It's just a filter I needed for my car
customer_reviews.text: Plain and simple - just needed a filter for my car. Just like the oil from the same manufacturer, I cannot talk myself into spending much more at a retail store than here on Amazon. I go where I can get the cheapest consumable products. Sadly however Amazon was beat out on the oil price, so they lost a sale on that but at least they sold me the filter :-)
customer_reviews.author: danji31

customer_reviews.title: Best To Use Motocraft Filters With your Ford Cars
customer_reviews.text: I've learned that it's best to use the Motorcraft FL910S filter in my new Ford Fiesta 1.6 liter because of the anti-drainback valve. The sooner you have oil pressure when starting your engine the better. If the oil drains back into the crankcase, you engine will have less lubrication for the time it takes to get oil back up to the top of your engine. Besides, these are the cheapest filters to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Willy J

customer_reviews.title: It fit and filters the oil.  Well worth the $4
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and fit my 1993 Saab 900s. For $4, I don't think you can go wrong. I'm only giving it 4 stars because I haven't run it that long, and have nothing to compare it to. But so far no leaks (and it matches my white car!).
customer_reviews.author: P. Piedra

customer_reviews.title: Mine was damaged
customer_reviews.text: I took the oil out of my car and when I went to change the filter the inner threading was damaged. Used these filters many times in the past and this must've been a manufacturing defect. Had to ask a neighbor to drive me to a local store to purchase another since I was stuck with no oil in my car
customer_reviews.author: **G R**

customer_reviews.title: Right filter for Kohler 14KW RESAL generator, extra capacity
customer_reviews.text: This is the right filter for Kohler 14KW RESAL generator, creating a little extra capacity for more oil to clean and lubricate your generator motor. Great quality filters at a solid value price.

customer_reviews.title: Does what an OEM part should.

Personally, I change my oil every 5k miles, and I haven’t had any issues or noticed any particulate in my used oil. Remember to lubricate the gasket, hand tighten, and you’ll never have an issue pulling it off for the next filter.

product_meta.title: Motorcraft FL-910S Oil Filter
product_meta.description:
Oil Filter

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Motorcraft filters are engineered to the high quality standards of the Ford Motor Company and are recommended by Ford as the original equipment replacement filter for Ford, Lincoln and Mercury vehicles. They are designed to help protect against engine wear by screening out abrasives, such as carbon, sand, dust and bits of metal before they can get into your oil. Pressure-relief valves help minimize the chance of contaminated oil circulating back into the engine and also help maintain the supply of oil to the engine under extreme cold conditions or if the filter gets clogged. The outer casings are constructed of steel, “ironed” for a precise fit, painted to resist rust and include flutings to ease removal. The efficient filter media offers increased dirt-collecting capability and ability to capture more engine-harming particles. Silicone anti-drain back valves help prevent oil from draining out of the filter and engine when the engine is not running and resist the aging effects that an engine’s high heat can cause.
feature_bullets: Helps protect against engine wear by screening out abrasives, such as carbon, sand, dust and bits of metal before they can get into your oil
Pressure-relief valves help minimize the chance of contaminated oil circulating back into the engine
Pressure-relief valves also help maintain the supply of oil to the engine under extreme cold conditions or if the filter gets clogged
Steel cases are “ironed” for a precise fit, fluted to ease removal and painted to resist rust
Efficient filter media offers increased dirt-collecting capability and ability to capture more engine-harming particles
